fields.description:
h2. Scenario:
 # Create a JIRA Service Desk, along with some Customers
 # Link the JIRA Service Desk to a Confluence Knowledge Base Space
 # In the space permissions, allow "Unlicensed users to access this space"
 # Set Confluence to talk to JIRA for user management

h2. Use Case:
 # Your service desk provides service for multiple companies.
 # Each service desk is restricted to the customers for that company
 # You only want to ensure that users can access the knowledge for their company

h2. The problem:

When a customer (who exists in Confluence) views an article, Confluence will prompt that user to log in - which opens in a new window.

While the customers cannot see the dashboard or other spaces in Confluence (because they do not have the "Use Confluence" permission), they can see other spaces with the "Allow unlicensed users to access this space" setting.

This can be problematic for customers who delegate Confluence to JIRA for user management and want to maintain confidential customer knowledge in a space - it's possible for other users to access those spaces (because Service Desk doesn't differentiate between if an unlicensed user could see the linked service desk.
h2. Possible Solutions:
 * A mechanism to check if the user is able to access the Service Desk linked to that space (i.e, is this user a valid customer for that service desk?)

h2. Workaround:
 # In JIRA, add your customers to groups - and then synchronise those groups to Confluence
 # At the top level page on the space, add a restriction to only allow "Confluence Users" (your staff members) and the name of your customer group to view and edit the pages in that space.

This will then stop any user not in those groups from viewing the pages in the space. The "Edit Pages" restriction doesn't allow customers to edit a page, as they're still unlicensed users.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism for Service Desk Customers to only access the Knowledge Base linked to the Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 30th October 2017}
{panel}
Hello all,

Thanks for all your comments. We would love to hear from you on what you’d expect from this feature improvement. Understanding this helps us craft the right thing, that fits your needs.

If you would like to help out, please take 2 minutes to answer these questions - [https://jsd-explorations.typeform.com/to/XlzAoY]

Cheers,

— JIRA Service Desk Team

 
----
So I love the relatively new approval feature for help desk workflows.

Something I wish I could do is add the Approval and Decline buttons into the notification email for the approver.

I attempted to do this using the API ([https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.8.1/#servicedeskapi/request/\|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.8.1/#servicedeskapi/request/]\{issueIdOrKey}/approval)

but found that it is still experimental and it can't be done with a simple link. 

I could create a bunch of embedded html inline javascript into the email that would get the approval id for the request and approver and then create form buttons in the email, but outlook and other email clients would probably block it, and that seems a cumbersome workaround.

We just have some users that are likely going to not hit the View Request button.

I suppose I could make an automation either with built in automation tools or the JIRA automation rules plugin that allows them to reply the word approve or decline, maybe even make those buttons in the email that say reply approve and makes it so a email is written with the word approve for them to send.

Point is, I realize there are some possible workarounds to make this sort of happen, but a built in way to have a approving user hit a button in their request needs approval email would greatly help simplify our users workflows and increase our service desk adoption.

 

Please and thank you =)
fields.summary: Approval From Email

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user sends an email that contains CC field and a user who is not meant to be a customer in the project is added to the project, there is no way to simply delete the user in the Customer page of the project.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a user sends an email and the company's security policy changes and they need to remove users who were added to the CC field of emails processed and made into users, they agents do not have any way to remove such users directly from the Customer page of the service desk project.

h5. Expected Behavior

An (x) would appear at the end of the column for the customer that allows the agent to directly delete the user they do not need similar to what is available for organizations.

h5. Actual Behavior

There are no direct ways to delete the user from the project as a customer.

h5. Workaround

# Hover your mouse over the user.
# When the pop-up comes up, Select *More* and from the options presented to you, select *Administer User*.
# Press Action and Select Delete User

If the user is a JIRA user or you need them as a customer in other projects, instead of step Deleting the user, use the following steps to remove them:
* Press *View Project Roles*.
** This would list all projects the user has a role in
* Press the *Edit Project Roles*.
* *Uncheck* the user from the *Service Desk customer* role.
* Save your changes.
fields.summary: Delete Customer

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When a single JIRA Action is completed satisfying both the START/STOP condition of a SLA Counter, the SLA Counter can result in being started but not stopped.
h4. How to reproduce

Set up Time to Resolution SLA as follow
 # START: *Unassigned to Assigned*
 # STOP: *Enter state: Resolved* or *Enter state: Closed*

Edit *transition screen* for Resolved and add *Assignee*
 # Scenario 1: *OPEN TICKET* → *ASSIGN TICKET* → *RESOLVE TICKET*
 ** Ticket is in OPEN state.
 ** *Assigned* ticket to myself. *Time to Resolution SLA* started counting as ticket has moved from *Assignee from Unassigned* as per START CONDITION.
 ** Resolved ticket - *Time to Resolution SLA* stopped counting. (/)
 # Scenario 2: *OPEN TICKET* → *RESOLVE TICKET*
 ** Ticket is in OPEN state.
 ** *Resolved* ticket and *set Assignee* and *Resolution Description*.
 ** *Time to Resolution SLA* started counting as ticket has moved from *Assignee from Unassigned* as per START CONDITION.
 ** The STOP CONDITION is also met as ticket is now in Resolved state but *Time to Resolution SLA* did not stop counting (x)

h4. Expected Result

Scenario 1 above working correctly as expected.
 Scenario 2 above should start the Timer and *stop the Timer* since Start Condition is met and then Stop Condition is also met.
h4. Actual Result

Scenario 1 above working correctly as expected. (/)
 Scenario 2 above should have a Stopped Timer but the Time To Resolution SLA is still counting (x)

It appears that JIRA Service Desk SLA is processing the SLA counter in the order JIRA is processing the action events. In this particular case, it looks like JIRA has processed the *Set Status to Resolution* and then *sets the Assignee* on the ticket. This explains why the counter is being Started and not Stopped.
h3. *Expected Behaviour*

Expecting JIRA to evaluate the Start/Pause/Stop SLA conditions after all the multiple events in a single action (e.g. Assign and set Resolved) were done so that the order of how JIRA processes the individual events is not relevant.
h4. Workaround

*Option 1:* After *Resolving* and *Assigning the ticket* in one action, close the ticket so the SLA Stop condition is evaluated for *Enter State: Closed* to stop the Timer.

*Option 2:* Alternatively, change the SLA Start/Pause/Stop Conditions so the Conditions are:
 # START: When ticket is created
 # PAUSE: When ticket is unassigned
 # STOP: When ticket is Resolved or Closed

Note that this will Stop the Timer when the ticket once unassigned.

*Option 3:* Change the workflow so that the Assignee must be set before a ticket can be Resolved
fields.summary: Start and stop conditions in the same action event does not stop SLA

No customer notifications are sent to Reporters and Request Participants.

N/A

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Collaborators (JIRA Core/Software users that are part of the Service Desk Team) can add internal comments and when an Agent edits the internal comment, the pop-up Edit Comment screen allows Agent to share the comment to the customer. However, the internal comment will not be shared after clicking on the _Share to customer_ button.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# On an existing Service Desk request, have a Collaborator to add an internal comment.
# Edit the internal comment as an Agent or the Assignee of the request.
# On the pop-up screen, select _Share to customer_ to make the internal comment public.

h3. Expected result
The internal comment will be a public comment and it will be shared to the customer.

h3. Actual result
The internal comment is still restricted and not viewable by the customer in the Portal.

h3. Notes
Since the button is available, it'd make the user thinks that it's possible to share a collaborator's comment to the customer. However, this is not true as the permission will still be validated and hence, the internal public will remain internal.
fields.summary: Share with customer option is allowed when editing internal comment made by a collaborator

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. *Issue Summary*

In JIRA Service Desk, if a company has teams in different Geo location and they have a calendar in JIRA Service Desk catering to each individual group based on location, if they move an issue from a location to another after some time has passed, the time is lost if the time expended occurs before the working time of the other Geolocations calendar work starts.

h5. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a 9-5 calendar for Hamburg and One for Ontario.
# Create a custom field location of type Single Select and values Ontario and Hamburg.
# Create an SLA goal based on each of these calendars and the custom field value.
# Create a new issue.
# Let some time pass in the SLA of Hamburg and then change the value of the location field to Ontario.

h5. *Expected Behavior*

The user expects that JIRA would *carry over the issue or at least store it somewhere* so they can use it for reporting purposes.

h5. *Actual Behavior*

JIRA would calculate how many hours passed in the currently set working hours instead.

If the user spent 2 hours and one hour overlaps between the 2 calendars, JIRA Service Desk would show only 1 hour passed in the SLA when the calendars change.

If the day has not started in the calendar you switch to, JIRA would reset the calendar throwing away all times used outside the working hours of the calendar.

h5. Possible Workaround

Users could consider using a 24/7 calendar and pause the issue at a particular status you do not want it to count until work is being done on it in the next geolocation.
fields.summary: Store Exhausted SLA time in Different Field

fields.description:
*Description of problem*
 In JIRA Service Desk, PSMQ is a component of automation and is present in versions 3.2.x and newer.
 * Note: PSMQ is present but not enabled in 3.2.x.
 * Enabled by default in 3.3.x and newer

PSMQ uses execution threads that are part of a thread pool and these threads are reused. A PSMQ thread may take up an excessive amount of heap due to the way threads are reused.

*Experienced Behavior*
 PSMQ threads using excessive heap. This can cause other effects, such as an OutOfMemory error.

When viewing heap dump:
 * PSMQ threads referred to as "PsmmqAsyncExecutors-job"
 * Thread is retaining a large amount of heap
 * Investigating the thread shows that heap is associated with ThreadLocalMap and com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache

!PSMQ-Heap.PNG!

*Details*
 This problem manifests on Automation PSMQ thread pool. Since threads are being reused, they might have pretty long lifetimes, and it seems like JiraThreadLocalUtils is calling the DefaultIndexManager#flushThreadLocalSearcher method, however in SearcherCache it will reassign the variable to a new map, rather than using ThreadLocal.remove() during threads lifetimes.
fields.summary: PSMQ threads can use excessive heap

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Attached image cannot be displayed in IE 11.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# In the Agent issue view, open an issue and click on the comment box.
# Paste a screenshot to the comment box using keyboard shortcut (Ctrl + V in Windows).
# Share the comment with customer.
# Access the issue via the Portal using IE 11.

h3. Expected result
The screenshot will be displayed.

h3. Actual result
The screenshot failed to load in the comment.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Cause
The screenshot uploaded is with MIME type is text/plain which IE will treat it as plain text instead of image

h3. Workaround
* Instead of pasting the screenshot directly to the comment, paste it to anywhere on the issue screen. A comment box will then pop up for you to include a comment and to share it to the customer or add to the issue.
* Use the thumbnail syntax as outlined [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=images] in the comment.
fields.summary: Attached screenshot failed to load in the Portal when using IE 11

If the Reporter on a request is also the Assignee, the request cannot be transitioned via the Customer Portal.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Show the _Resolve this issue_ transition on the customer portal as per [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver033/configuring-the-customer-portal-861255225.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-addTransitionsAddtransitions].
# As an Agent, create a request and assign it to yourself.
# Go to the Customer Portal and click on _Resolve this issue_.
# A pop-up for comment (optional) will be displayed, click on _Resolve this issue_.

h3. Expected result
The issue is resolved.

h3. Actual result
An error pop up, the issue is not resolved. An NPE below can be seen in the {{atlassian-jira.log}}.
{code}
2017-08-24 14:28:13,133 http-nio-8082-exec-12 url:/rest/servicedesk/1/custo.../transition username:agent1  ERROR agent1 596x219709x9 17nivfx 207.61.145.4,10.0.0.7 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/requests/transition [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:276)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getActionDescriptor(OSWorkflowManager.java:389)
...
{code}

!image-2017-08-28-21-07-01-023.png!

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
In the generic [Upgrading JIRA applications documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/upgrading-jira-applications-using-the-installer-881683273.html] and Service Desk upgrade notes, the requirement to upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.0 before upgrading to JIRA Service Desk 3.x has been explicitly mentioned. 

However, that is the *upgrade requirement*. For instance which the Service Desk or add-on was installed and uninstalled previously, installing Service Desk 3.x is a *new installation, not upgrade*. Thus they usually install the application directly instead of following the upgrade path which resulted in the problem described in [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/after-upgrading-to-jira-service-desk-3-2-x-or-greater-service-desk-project-s-navigation-bar-shows-unable-to-render-element-due-to-an-error-845943102.html].

h3. Suggestion
* Include the scenario above in all the related documentation and make it really clear and obvious so that it won't be missed
* Include methods of checking if Service Desk has been installed prior to adding the application to the instance
fields.summary: Update documentation to detect previous installation of Service Desk before upgrade or installation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Service desk report gadget is available in JIRA Cloud but not in Server. After migrating to Server, all Dashboards with the Service desk report gadget will not be accessible in Server with error 500 on the UI.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# In a JIRA Cloud instance, create a new dashboard with the Service desk report gadget.
# Generate a backup for server and restore it to a Server instance.
# Upon successful restoration, log in and browse the dashboard created in Step 1.

h3. Expected result
The dashboard can be viewed properly with the Service desk report gadget not available due to [this limitation|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-222].

h3. Actual result
The dashboard will display a 500 error page with error below in the stack trace.
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
{code}

h3. Workaround
Remove the Service desk report gadgets from all dashboards before generating a backup for Server migration
OR
Fix it from the database side
(i) Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any alter, insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first.
# Execute the SQL query below to identify all dashboards with the Service desk report gadget.
{code:SQL}
select * from portletconfiguration where (dashboard_module_complete_key like '%servicedesk%' OR dashboard_module_complete_key like '%buble%');
{code}
# To remove the gadgets from these dashboards, execute the SQL query below.
{code:SQL}
delete from portletconfiguration where (dashboard_module_complete_key like '%servicedesk%' OR dashboard_module_complete_key like '%buble%');
{code}
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Dashboard is not accessible after migrating from Cloud to Server throwing "String index out of range: -1"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Emails that are composed by the Mac Outlook client are sent with both plain text and HTML versions of the body encode using content-type multipart/alternative.  JIRA Service Desk processes only the plain text content and then creates an attachment of the HTML content for these emails.

h3. Environment
* Mac Outlook client
* Exchange or Gmail as mail server
* Service Desk Mail Handler

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Service Desk Mail handler for a Service Desk project
# Email the mail handler address to either create or comment on a ticket
# Browse the ticket in the main JIRA application as a Service Desk agent and notice the attachment added with the HTML version of the email body

h3. Expected Results
HTML version is parsed and turned into wiki markup for the ticket description or comment

h3. Actual Results
The plain text version of the content is used for the issue description or added as a comment and an attachment containing the HTML version of the email body is attached to the ticket.

For Exchange servers, this attachment will typically be named _text.html_, while for Gmail is can be random.
 
h3. Notes
This is an example email:
 [^Re- [JIRA] (TEST-8) Commented- I need help.eml] 

Note the content-type:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Content-type: multipart/alternative;
{code}

Screenshot of ticket created from a gmail account with message sent from Mac Outlook:
 !Screen Shot 2017-08-24 at 3.37.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
According to a similar ticket (JRASERVER-62023) for the JIRA Core mail handler, these are possible workarounds, but I have not been able to confirm their effectiveness:
* Send email from MAC Outlook Client on plain TEXT format.
* Send email from MAC Outlook Client on plain HTML format with the option 'Preferred encoding for new messages' unchecked in Outlook Composing Configuration.
fields.summary: multipart/alternative emails from Mac outlook are processed as plain text with the HTML version of the message added as an attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sub-task is added as a Standard issue type when a JIRA Service Desk project is added on a new install.
h3. Environment
 * Fresh install of JIRA including JIRA Service Desk
 * No projects exist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Launch JIRA in browser
 # Add license (eval is fine) and enter admin info
 # Create a new project and select "IT Service Desk"
 # Note that "Sub-task" is one of the issue types that will be created
 # Browse to *⚙* > *Issues* > *Issue Types*

h3. Expected Results

There now exists an Issue type with the name _Sub-task_ and the type _Sub-Task_.
h3. Actual Results

The _Sub-task_ issue type is a _Standard_ issue type. Later, when creating Business projects which include a Sub-task issue type, the same issue type is used. 
h3. Workaround
Create a Business or Software project which includes the Sub-task issue type first. Subsequently-created Service Desk projects will use this Sub-task issue type instead.
fields.summary: Sub-task issue type created as Standard instead of Sub-task

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

When JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler processes an email where the body of the email is encoded as *Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64*:

# For a new ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Description (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)
# For an existing ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Comment (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)

The behaviour works as expected (no additional attachment) when email body is encoded as *Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable*.

h4. How to reproduce

# Send an email to the JIRA Service Desk listening email address
# Once the email has arrived and processed by JIRA Service Desk
#* Extract out the contents of AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK and decode
#* Update the main body encoding from *Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable* to *Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64*
#* Also encode the actual email body to *base64*
#* Re-encode the whole email as *base64*
#* Re-update into AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK and set AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM.status to 'NEW' for reprocessing


h4. Expected Result

Email body updated into Ticket Description / Ticket Comment without adding it again as an attachment.


h4. Actual Result

In JIRA Service Desk (for both Server and Cloud):

# For a new ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Description (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)
# For an existing ticket - the decoded contents are added into Ticket Comment (but HTML is also added as an attachment to the ticket)

h4.Workaround

There is no usability issue as the comment is posted into the ticket appropriately but the redundant attachment is occupying additional disk space.

The work around would be to simply delete the attachment (which has a random 8 character name such as ohecJTek)
fields.summary: Email body encoded as Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 added as duplicate attachment

fields.description:
h5. *Issue Summary*
When a customer selects a different language than the system language used by JIRA, some system fields for example "summary", "attachments" are not translated.
though the description of some of these fields are correctly translated as seen in the image below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Access JIRA Service Desk customer portal as a customer.
# Change the profile language to German or other supported languages (System Language is set to English).
# Save the change.
# Attempt to create an issues in the customer portal.

h5. Expected Behavior
JIRA would translate the issue fields to the language the customer selected.

h5. Actual Behavior
JIRA Service Desk would show the fields in the language which JIRA is set to rather than the one selected by the customer.

h5. Note:
* This functionality seems to have been addressed in JIRA Service Desk Cloud as seen [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/05/translate-your-customer-portal]
* Changing the system language does not change this behavior.
* System fields would be expected to be translated if the language pack is bundled with Jira.
* Custom fields have an option to translate them at Jira Administration > issues > Custom fields, but this does not seem to be used by Service Desk.
fields.summary: Request Form Not Translated Correctly in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a customer searches for an issue in JIRA Service Desk Customer portal and logs in for the first time, they are directed to Confluence and from here, the Customer can access any pages even those that they should not have access to.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to your customer portal as a newly created customer.
# Perform a search and Select one of the suggested pages.
# Due to this being the first login, JIRA would direct the user to the customer portal.
# While at confluence, if a page is not restricted, it would be visible even if the user should not have been able to view the page originally (if it was restricted with a label).
# Also other spaces may be accessible if the link for them appear in any tickets in the page the customer is accessing.

h5. Feature Request

Can JIRA Service Desk handle all the authentication without requiring the redirection to Confluence or can it automatically redirect the user back to itself following a login to prevent the user from accessing Confluence proper.

h5. Workaround

Confluence page restriction  can be used to restrict the pages from the user, however, this may not necessarily be scalable depending on how many pages are involved at the point the confluence was connected to JIRA Service Desk to serve as a knowledge base.
fields.summary: Other Spaces and Pages Accessible From Knowledge Base article

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Feature Summary

Currently in JIRA, users can add organizations or request participants to their tickets. However, when a user belongs to an organization, the organization is set by default in the share option rather than private and there is no way to configure this.

More importantly, there is no way to prevent customers from setting organizations but still be able to add Request Participants.

h5. Use Case

In an company with various branches in different geolocations, if an organization is created based on the branches, when a user creates a ticket, if he does not intentionally go to select private, his ticket would be shared with everyone and when this happens to be a private ticket that should have been shared only with specific staff(say finance report or health record), the organization field would leak the information out.

h5. Feature Request

# Add a functionality that allows the JIRA Admin disable the ability for customers to share with an organization while still maintaining the ability to share with individual users.
# Allow the JIRA Service Desk admin specify the default for the share option.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Service Desk project Admin Disable Customer's ability to set organization

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
With JIRA Software installed with JIRA Service Desk, an agent with Service Desk Team role who raises a ticket through the customer portal is able to receive internal comment emails.

This looks to be un-intended function as bug ticket - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2418
{quote}
Hi,
This is working as desired - if a user is the reporter or a participant of a request, then we consider them to be playing the "customer" persona for that particular request. Therefore, they only receive the "customer" notifications and are blocked from receiving any internal JIRA notifications - this avoids confusion / noisiness around sending 2 sets of notifications.
It is best not to add agents as participants if you want to keep them in the loop for internal activity (agents can still view requests on the portal without being a participant).
Kind Regards,
Oliver Wessels
JIRA Service Desk Engineer
{quote}

*Environment*
JIRA Service Desk 3.6.1 and JIRA Software 7.4.1

*Steps to Reproduce*
-Have JIRA Software installed with JIRA Service Desk.- Reproducible with just JSD installed
# Raise a ticket through the customer portal with Agent that has Service Desk Team role for the project.
# (at)mention the Agent in an Internal Comment
# Agent will receive a "XXX has mentioned you in "Request type" PROJ-XXX

*Expected Behavior*
Agent would be playing the Customer persona and should not receive the (at)mention email.

*Actual Behavior*
Agent receives the (at)mention email

-This is *not* reproducible with just JIRA Service Desk installed as standalone.-
Agent will not receive the (at)mention email as per [JSDSERVER-2418|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2418]
fields.summary: JSD internal comment email being sent to agent with service desk team role when they raise ticket through customer portal

JIRA Service Desk 3.4.x

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup the time to resolution condition in a JIRA Project.
# Transition an issue to a status such as done to meet the condition for the SLA to be met.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if we send an email to service desk mail handler with .eml attachment with the subject more than 50 characters, the attachment is added correctly in the ticket but there is extra underscore line in between each word in the subject as shown in the image below:
 !service desk eml attachment.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Step To Replicate
# Compose a new email in outlook.
# Add outlook item and choose existing email as attachment (make sure the email subject is more than 50 character)
# Send the email to service desk mail handler.

h3. Suggested Solution
Better handling of outlook item attachment in JIRA so that it will not distort the original attachment.

h3. Why this is important
As many organization is using outlook as their main email client due to security purposes it is important for JIRA to be handle outlook attachment correctly as an organization is not allowed to use google, yahoo or other free mail client due to security concern.

h3. Workaround 
Currently, in outlook there is two option to attach email attachment as shown below:
* Attach file 
* Attach Item

The behavior only happens if the user uses attach item feature, if they save the email locally to their computer and attach using *attach file* option the .eml attachment with more than 50 character works fine without any distortion.
fields.summary: Better Handling Of .eml Attachment with More Than 50 Character in Mail Request

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk emails fail with error "Your email request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in" if _Service Desk Customer - Portal Access_ is removed from _Schedule Issues_ project permission.
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk 3.6.0
 Any OS
 Any database

As an admin, I do not want to expose the customer portal to any customers and I do not wish to grant public access. Therefore, I have removed all references to the Service Desk Portal from my Service Desk project permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a new service desk project
 # Configure the email channel
 # Remove the group _Service Desk Customer_ from the {{Schedule Issues}} project permission
 # As a customer who is not also a JIRA user with {{Schedule Issues}} permission in that project, send an email to the email channel address.

h3. *Expected Result:* A new issue is created.
h3. *Actual Result:* No new issue is created. An error appears in the mail processing log: "Your email request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in."
h3. Workaround

Ensure that the _Service Desk Customer - Portal Access_ group of users has the _Schedule Issues_ project permission for the Service Desk project
h3. Notes

The root cause of this issue was found by signing in to the portal as a user whose emails were failing and attempting to create an issue as that user. In doing so, a different error message is thrown pointing to the project permission in question.
fields.summary: Removing "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" from Schedule Issues project permission results in "Your email request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Background and reason for this suggestion*

Currently, JIRA Service Desk provides a history for incoming emails processed but it doesn't show the history of generated customer notifications.

Up until now, I have encountered two bugs which caused Service Desk customer notifications not going out. These were JRASERVER-64325 and JSDSERVER-5273.

To prevent them to happen I have created a non-JIRA dashboard which queries the database directly and shows me troublesome database entries. This is sufficient for issues I am aware of, but if any new type of problem occurs, I will not notice it until my customers report it to me.

*The essence of this suggestion*

I propose a __ new feature of _JIRA Service Desk customer notification audit_*,*  where admins could see the frequency of outgoing customer emails and maybe even, set alarm rules for situations when no customer notification is generated for the whole day.

If such alarms existed, any JIRA Service Desk manager would know about issues with customer emails after one day instead of three (or more).
fields.summary: Service Desk customer notification audit

fields.description:
categorizing service requests by organization of the customer in JIRA service desk is really helpful. 

Occasionally, we need to create development tickets that are also linked to an organization. It would be incredibly helpful, if the _organziations_ field could be used for other projects / issue types too.
h2. Current behavior:
 * _Organizations_ field shows up for service request issues
 * _Organzations_ field can be added to other issue types on other projects via admin / "add field". Field gets listed as having been added, but then the popup message appears:

{quote}The field was added successfully, but you do not have edit permissions.
{quote} * Consequently, the _Organizations_ field does *not* show up on the issue type where it was added
 * It is *not* visible on the view  or edit screens, even though the "where is my field" function says that it would be present:

{quote}The field 'Organizations' is present on the screen 'Default Screen' configured for this issue
{quote}
h2. Desired behavior:

Be able to use the _Organizations_ field in all projects and issue types.

 

Not sure if this is a bug or a suggestion...
fields.summary: Allow reuse of "Organizations" field for other issue types & projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
There's no way to keep a Portal open for sign up but restrict it from existing/internal users

h3. Suggestion
To have an option to mark the existing users or any registered customers as non-customers so that these users will not be able to access the Portals but keeping the Portal public at the same time

h3. Why is it important
The current options to keep a Portal public or restricted are too rigid, some portals have to be public and Agents or admins can manage their access manually after the signup. The user management functionalities per SD project or Portal should be more flexible.

fields.description:
Customers that never hit the portal splash page 
http://xxx/servicedesk/customer/portal/6
will never see the announcement (configured as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver031/configuring-the-customer-portal-802164737.html)

Clients that have a link right to a particular request type or the Requests page never hit the splash page which means they never see important announcements about planned maintenance windows etc.

The announcement should show on every page, just like it does in JIRA and Confluence.

This includes but is not limited to:

http://xxx/servicedesk/customer/portals
http://xxx/servicedesk/customer/portal/6/create/28
http://xxx/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?status=open&reporter=all

Basically every page the customer hits, whether via a bookmark they have or navigating the site should see the banner.

We have had occurrences where our customers on the site never save the maintenance announcement because they have no need to hit the splash page http://xxx/servicedesk/customer/portal/6
fields.summary: Need annoucement banner on all pages, not just Portal Splash page

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When the mail handler is attempting to strip a large text or image from reply email, the mail processor job could be aborted and hence not able to process any following mail items.

h3. Symptoms
* Emails are read
* The _Strip quotes_ option in {{Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk Email requests}} is *Strip quotes*
* Mail Puller job is working fine as shown in {{Administration > System > Scheduled jobs}}
* Mail Processor job's status is _Already running_
* In {{AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM}} database table, recent entries are in status _NEW_ instead of _PROCESSED_ or _FILTERED_.

h3. Workaround steps
# Back up  the JIRA database.
# Disable the _Strip quotes_ option in {{Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk Email requests}}.
# Stop JIRA.
# Remove the Mail Processor job from the database.
{code:SQL}
delete from rundetails where job_id like '%Processor%'
{code}
# Start JIRA.

h3. Note
If the above workaround doesn't help, check the below KB in case Mail Processor gets stuck by Signature Removal scripts:
* [JIRA Service Desk Mail Processor gets Stuck waiting for Signature Removal script to Complete|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Service+Desk+Mail+Processor+gets+Stuck+waiting+for+Signature+Removal+script+to+Complete]
fields.summary: Mail Processor job aborted when SD mail handler failed to strip quotes from a reply email to existing request

** https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver036/managing-service-desk-notifications-921471702.html

EXE: The Link under the section: *How different roles receive notifications* is pointing the the JIRA Cloud documentation space:
{quote}
When agents and admins work on an issue, they receive email notifications as part of the the project's JIRA notification scheme. [Read more about the JIRA notification scheme | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html].

And the Hyper link should resolve to:

** https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/creating-a-notification-scheme-881683651.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Review the Documents and locate the corresponding JIRA server documentation links per version, Compatibility list can be found here:
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions

h3.Workaround:
- On Cloud Documentation pages select the Doc Version switcher and select the correct server version of the document:
!Screen Shot 2017-07-27 at 10.39.52 AM.png|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current Release Notes and Upgrade Notes for JIRA Service Desk 3.0 does not clearly state the changes made on the Email Request for Service Desk
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-0-x-release-notes-770801761.html#JIRAServiceDesk3.0.xreleasenotes-v3.0.0v3.0.0-6October2015
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html

For example, the changes of how JIRA Mail Handler and JIRA Service Desk Mail Request is handling the comments which were reported in [JSDCLOUD-5093|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5093] but is an expected behavior. 
* Comments by customers going through Mail handler added as Internal comments
* JIRA Service Desk 2.x able to use JIRA Mail Handler for Customers to add comments without issues

h3. Suggested Solution
* Update the [Upgrade Notes 3.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html] to include this information
* Add an official Service Desk documentation on changes around Mail Request since Service Desk 2.x

h3. Why this is important
Clients have already configured a working Service Desk and the unknown Mail Request vs Mail handler changes created unnecessary challenges for completing JIRA and Service Desk upgrade.
fields.summary: Improve Upgrade Notes on Service Desk Mail Requests Changes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Service Desk require the configuration of one Email Address per Service Desk project. This means, having 100+ Service Desk projects will equal to needing 100+ email addresses.

h3. Suggested Solution
This request is specific to adding/creating *comments* to have only a single Service Desk Email Request configured for *all* Service Desk projects configured. It will be able to differentiate the Issue Key and added the comment correctly to the right Service Desk Request.

h3. Why this is important
Large clients will want to have more than 1000 Service Desk projects configured and this will mean a requirement to have 1000 email addresses. Each of them has to be _manually_ configured on the Email Requests setting.
fields.summary: Allow single Email to handle All Service Desk comments

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA's delegated user directory will only automatically create users if users try to log into the application. Problem is that with JIRA Service Desk, most users will only use JIRA via email, which creates a new user with their email address regardless if they already have a user on LDAP server or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA Service Desk incoming mail should look up for users on Delegated LDAP server using their email address.

h3. Workaround 
Option 1:
* Use a Connector directory instead and synchronize all users so all LDAP users using JIRA Service Desk will already have a user
Option 2:
* Change the User Name attribute to the mail attribute and move the Internal directory to the bottom.
fields.summary: JIRA should look for email address on LDAP server when creating new users

h3. Summary
When running on Oracle database, JIRA Service Desk will insert NULL value to {{TEXT_CONTENT}} column of {{AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE}} table when the notification in question does not contain any plain text.

h3. Environment
* JIRA is running on Oracle database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk project with sample data.
# Navigate to *Project settings > Customer notifications* and modify the template for "Public comment added" rule as shown below:
 !2017-07-25_comment-added.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a public comment which contains only an image to one of the ticket.
# Observing the data in {{AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE}} table.

h3. Expected Results
A new row with a empty string for {{TEXT_CONTENT}} column is inserted.

h3. Actual Results
A new row with NULL for {{TEXT_CONTENT}} column is inserted.
The below exception is thrown in the log file when JIRA tried to send notification :
{noformat}
2017-07-18 14:58:58,666 Caesium-1-1 ERROR anonymous     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'sd.custom.notification.batch.send' failed
java.lang.RuntimeException: no text content set

The issue cannot be reproduced on PostgreSQL database, in which two single quotes ({{''}}) are inserted to the database to represent an empty string instead of NULL.

h3.Workaround
Modify the relevant notification template to include some plain text message or use the default template.
fields.summary: Notifications that contain only an image will break SD notification job when using Oracle database

fields.description:
The P2 Java API for Service Desk has been annotated as experimental for almost 2 years.

Tidy up the API with a final contract, such as int/long used correctly and consistently for entity identification.

Then change the contract to PublicApi on the core interfaces, to provide some confidence to developers that it will no longer shift beneath them.

Aim for being done by 3.8.0
fields.summary: Finalise aspects of public P2 Java api
